poem:
**Secondhand Reverie**

Handwoven threads whisper tales,   
stitched in seams time stitched again—  
fabrics of fable and folklore,  
second lives weaving dreams anew.  
In cobbled corners of curious shops,  
pre-loved treasures rise, glinted with grace—  
sartorial ghosts in sunlight rest,  
wearing their history like a badge,  
never last, never least.  
Bonne chance, thrifters.
